Blog Info

After completing a project in Ruby I inadvertantly discovered a more fun and exciting way of blogging with Jekyll. It provides a lightweight, blog-aware static site that translates plain text to web pages using markdown files, tags, and css. I’m using the Hyde theme (v2.1.0) for Poole and publish to Github Pages. I run Jeckyll with Ruby 2.5 locally in macOS to manage the site before using git to publish new posts or site changes publicly. I’m using the dracula.css theme for Rougue, a Syntax Highlighter written in Ruby.
